definition: to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

sentences.english: The airplane weighs five tons when unloaded.
sentences.chinese: 这架飞机不载货时重五吨。

sentences.english: The age of the carrying vessel chartered by the Seller shall not
sentences.chinese: 卖方所租载货船只船龄不得超过15年。

sentences.english: He knew he exceeded that. He doubled it.
sentences.chinese: 船长知道船的载货量已经超出一倍了。

sentences.english: The airplane weighs five tons unloaded.
sentences.chinese: 这架飞机不载货时重五吨。

sentences.english: The diaphram type air brake chambers are widely used on heavy and medium trucks in our country.
sentences.chinese: 随着载货汽车的发展，膜片式气室得到了广泛的应用。

sentences.english: The layout optimization of stiffeners for engine flywheel housing of a truck was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 论述了载货汽车发动机飞轮壳加强筋的布置优化设计。

sentences.english: The goods vehicles were rolled on in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 这些载货车在新加坡登船。

sentences.english: In Anterwerp, all the copper bars were brought alongside by lorries.
sentences.chinese: 在安特卫普，所有铜条都是用载货卡车运送的。

sentences.english: The age of the carrying vessel chartered by the Seller shall not exceed 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 卖方所租载货船只船龄不得超过15年。
不知道那个芭乐，不在载货单上。

sentences.english: The train carried coal to Qinhuangdao and then deadheaded back to Tianjin to pick up another load.
sentences.chinese: 这火车先把煤运至秦皇岛，然后放空车到天津载货。

sentences.english: He imported wine by the boatload .
sentences.chinese: 一条船的载货量很难用确切数字表示。

sentences.english: Secondly, trucks of the whole province are expected to increase greatly in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 二是全省载货车有望在2007年创出新高。

sentences.english: The structure and operating principle of a van truck's hydraulic tail-lift mechanism are introduced;
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种新的厢式载货汽车液压尾板举升机构。

sentences.english: Lifts are designed primarily for the delivery of goods is usually someone with the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 载货电梯主要为运送货物而设计通常有人伴随的电梯。

definition: to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]
dead weight/weight capacity of a vehicle
to load sth onto a ship etc
